availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Milwaukee, Wisconsin, attorney general. Wisconsin native. Married to Sarah F. Smith. Father of Anna E. Smith, Henry L. Smith, and Eva E. Smith. Treasurer of the Wisconsin Home Insurance Company in 1855. Attorney in Milwaukee in 1860. Member of the Republican Party. Attorney General of Wisconsin from 1862 to 1866.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Wisconsin, Milwaukee County, Milwaukee, Ward 4, p. 73.; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Wisconsin, Milwaukee County, Milwaukee, Ward 7, p. 23.; Janesville Weekly Gazette (Janesville, Wis.), October 30, 1863, p. 3; The Daily Milwaukee News (Milwaukee, Wis.), October 9, 1855, p. 4; "Died in London," The Weekly Wisconsin (Milwaukee, Wis.), November 11, 1899, p. 4.
